intro: Discocalyx orthoneura, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and small, white flowers. The plant relies on its host for water and nutrients, while it provides shelter for various insects and birds. Its berries are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain wildlife species. Discocalyx orthoneura is often found in temperate regions and is an important component of forest ecosystems.
